item.title: Finding K in K-Means
item.description: Finding K in K-Means So when applying K-Means Clustring, one comes at a point where he/she has to decide how many cluster they want, now one can not go and tell 2,3, or 4 clusters there should be a some evidence that clustering the data into ‘k’ clusters will yeild good results. So I met this problem, after searching for what can be done about this problem I stumble upon a something called ‘Silhouette Analysis’
